bugs.title: mingw-gdk-pixbuf: gdk-pixbuf: integer multiplication overflow in DecodeHeader function in io-bmp.c [epel-7]

bugzilla.short_desc: mingw-gdk-pixbuf: gdk-pixbuf: integer multiplication overflow in DecodeHeader function in io-bmp.c [epel-7]

blocked.short_desc: gdk-pixbuf: integer multiplication overflow in DecodeHeader function in io-bmp.c

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw as found in gdk-pixbuf. The function DecodeHeader in io-bmp.c have a unchecked integer variable that could be overflown, allowing a bmp file to be used to cause denial of service.

Upstream bug:

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=776694

Upstream patch:

https://bug776694.bugzilla-attachments.gnome.org/attachment.cgi?id=355543

References:

https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1053417

Created gdk-pixbuf2 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1480601]


Created mingw-gdk-pixbuf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1480599]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1480600]

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as

when new packages are pushed to stable.
